intro: Antidesma neriifolium, commonly known as black-leaved antidesma, is a tropical shrub or small tree native to parts of Africa and the Indian Ocean islands. It is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves that are opposite and elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by red, fleshy berries that are an important food source for various birds and animals. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies and local horticulture.
